description.narrative: The project aims that indigenous women of Chile members of the Association ANAMURI (Asociacion nacional de mujeres rurales e indigenas) learn and disseminate information about the international human rights instruments such as CEDAW (Convention on the elim ination of all forms of discrimination of women) and the Convention 169 of ILO on indigenous people rights. The objective is to strengthen the leadership of indigenous women on these issues through 6 workshops around the country 3 of them in the Northern r egions and 3 of them in the South. 25 indigenous women will be invited to each workshop. As a result the project also aims at producing an action plan.The indigenous women in Chile face three kinds of forms of discrimination as women as poor and as indigen ous due to the cultural and historical process in the country.
